verses.verse: These <WH428> also <WH1571> are proverbs <WH4912> of Solomon <WH8010> which <WH834> the men <WH376> of Hezekiah, <WH2396> king <WH4428> of Judah, <WH3063> transcribed. <WH6275>
It is the glory <WH9202> of God <WH430> to conceal <WH5641> a matter, <WH1697> But the glory <WH9202> of kings <WH4428> is to search <WH2713> out a matter. <WH1697>
[As] the heavens <WH8064> for height <WH7312> and the earth <WH776> for depth, <WH6011> So the heart <WH3820> of kings <WH4428> is unsearchable. <WH369> <WH2714>
Take <WH1898> away <WH1898> the dross <WH5509> from the silver, <WH3701> And there comes <WH3318> out a vessel <WH3627> for the smith; <WH6884>
Take <WH1898> away <WH1898> the wicked <WH7563> [from] before <WH6440> the king, <WH4428> And his throne <WH3678> will be established <WH3559> in righteousness. <WH6664>
Do not claim <WH1921> honor <WH1921> in the presence <WH6440> of the king, <WH4428> And do not stand <WH5975> in the place <WH4725> of great <WH1419> men; <WH1419>

For it is better <WH2896> that it be said <WH559> to you, "Come <WH5927> up here, <WH2008>" Than <WH4480> that you should be put <WH8213> lower <WH8213> in the presence <WH6440> of the prince, <WH5081> Whom <WH834> your eyes <WH5869> have seen. <WH7200>

Do not go <WH3318> out hastily <WH4118> to argue <WH7378> [your case;] Otherwise, <WH6435> what <WH4100> will you do <WH6213> in the end, <WH319> When your neighbor <WH7453> puts <WH3637> you to shame <WH3637>?
Argue <WH7378> your case <WH7379> with your neighbor, <WH7453> And do not reveal <WH1540> the secret <WH5475> of another, <WH312>
Lest <WH6435> he who hears <WH8085> [it] reproach <WH9154> you, And the evil <WH1681> report <WH1681> about you not pass <WH7725> away. <WH7725>
[Like] apples <WH8598> of gold <WH2091> in settings <WH4906> of silver <WH3701> Is a word <WH1697> spoken <WH1696> in right circumstances. <WH655>
[Like] an earring <WH5141> of gold <WH2091> and an ornament <WH2481> of fine <WH3800> gold <WH3800> Is a wise <WH2450> reprover <WH3198> to a listening <WH8085> ear. <WH241>

Like the cold <WH9491> of snow <WH7950> in the time <WH3117> of harvest <WH7105> Is a faithful <WH539> messenger <WH6735> to those who send <WH7971> him, For he refreshes <WH7725> the soul <WH5315> of his masters. <WH113>
[Like] clouds <WH9347> and wind <WH7307> without <WH369> rain <WH1653> Is a man <WH376> who boasts <WH1984> of his gifts <WH4991> falsely. <WH8267>
By forbearance <WH753> <WH639> a ruler <WH7101> may be persuaded, <WH6601> And a soft <WH7390> tongue <WH3956> breaks <WH7665> the bone. <WH1634>
Have you found <WH4672> honey <WH1706>? Eat <WH398> [only] what <WH1767> you need, <WH1767> Lest <WH6435> you have <WH7646> it in excess <WH7646> and vomit <WH9513> it.
Let your foot <WH7272> rarely <WH3365> be in your neighbor's house, <WH1004> Lest <WH6435> he become <WH7646> weary <WH7646> of you and hate <WH8130> you.
[Like] a club <WH4650> and a sword <WH2719> and a sharp <WH8150> arrow <WH2671> Is a man <WH376> who bears <WH6030> false <WH8267> witness <WH5707> against his neighbor. <WH7453>
[Like] a bad <WH9570> tooth <WH8127> and an unsteady <WH4571> foot <WH7272> Is confidence <WH4009> in a faithless <WH898> man in time <WH3117> of trouble. <WH6869>

[Like] one who takes <WH9380> off <WH9380> a garment <WH899> on a cold <WH7135> day, <WH3117> [or like] vinegar <WH2558> on soda, <WH5427> Is he who sings <WH7891> songs <WH7892> to a troubled <WH7451> heart. <WH3820>
If <WH518> your enemy <WH8130> is hungry, <WH7457> give <WH398> him food <WH3899> to eat; <WH398> And if <WH518> he is thirsty, <WH6771> give <WH8248> him water <WH4325> to drink; <WH8248>
For you will heap <WH2846> burning coals <WH1513> on his head, <WH7218> And the Lord <WH3068> will reward <WH9608> you.
The north <WH6828> wind <WH7307> brings <WH9123> forth <WH9123> rain, <WH1653> And a backbiting <WH5643> tongue, <WH3956> an angry <WH2194> countenance. <WH6440>
It is better <WH2896> to live <WH3427> in a corner <WH6438> of the roof <WH1406> Than <WH4480> in a house <WH1004> shared <WH2267> with a contentious <WH4066> woman. <WH802>
[Like] cold <WH7119> water <WH4325> to a weary <WH5889> soul, <WH5315> So is good <WH2896> news <WH8052> from a distant <WH4801> land. <WH776>
[Like] a trampled <WH7511> spring <WH4599> and a polluted <WH7843> well <WH4726> Is a righteous <WH6662> man <WH6662> who gives <WH4131> way <WH4131> before <WH6440> the wicked. <WH7563>
It is not good <WH2896> to eat <WH398> much <WH7235> honey, <WH1706> Nor <WH3808> is it glory <WH9202> to search <WH2714> out one's own glory. <WH9202>
[Like] a city <WH5892> that is broken <WH6555> into [and] without <WH369> walls <WH2346> Is a man <WH376> who <WH834> has <WH369> no <WH369> control <WH4623> over his spirit. <WH7307>
